title: Bon Clay Survived Magellan's Attack
theory: Despite the episode strongly implying Bentham's death at Magellan's hands, many fans theorized he would survive. The theory suggested that his Clone-Clone Fruit powers or his resilience would allow him to escape death, and that Oda wouldn't kill off such a beloved character off-screen.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: This theory was later confirmed in cover stories showing Bon Clay alive and ruling Level 5.5 as the new Queen of Newkama Land

evidence: Bon Clay's death was not shown on-screen
Magellan asked for 'last words' but the actual fight wasn't depicted
One Piece rarely kills characters permanently, especially beloved ones
The scene focused on emotional impact rather than definitive death
counterEvidence: The scene was framed as a sacrifice and farewell
No immediate indication of survival was given

title: Bon Clay Will Join the Straw Hat Pirates
theory: After his heroic sacrifice and the strong bond formed with Luffy during the Impel Down arc, some fans theorized that Bentham would eventually be rescued and join the Straw Hat Pirates as an official crew member. His loyalty, unique abilities, and character development seemed to fit the pattern of Straw Hat recruitment.
author: Reddit One Piece Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory remains unconfirmed through current episodes, though Bon Clay's survival was confirmed

evidence: Strong bond with Luffy established across multiple arcs
Demonstrated extreme loyalty and willingness to sacrifice for Luffy
Unique Devil Fruit ability would be valuable to the crew
Character development arc from villain to hero mirrors other Straw Hats
Has appeared in multiple arcs helping Luffy
counterEvidence: Bon Clay's story had a perfect conclusion with his sacrifice
He found a new home as Queen of Newkama Land in Impel Down
Adding him might diminish the impact of his sacrifice scene
The Straw Hats' core roster is generally considered complete
His role as a recurring ally may be more narratively powerful

title: The Gate of Justice Opened for a Reason
theory: Some fans theorized that the Gate of Justice opening wasn't just plot convenience, but part of a larger plan or manipulation. Theories ranged from World Government conspiracy to allow war at Marineford, to mysterious forces helping Luffy's journey, to foreshadowing of deeper significance of the 'Gates of Justice' symbolism in the story.
author: One Piece Theory Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Relates to the Marineford War arc events

evidence: The timing allowed Luffy to reach Marineford for the war
Multiple gates opened around the same time period
The World Government might have wanted the war to proceed
Symbolic significance of 'Justice' gates in the story
counterEvidence: Bentham's sacrifice and actions were clearly shown opening the gate
No evidence of manipulation or conspiracy presented
The mechanism destruction was explicitly depicted
Story presented it as straightforward heroic action

title: Bentham's Sacrifice Foreshadows Greater Sacrifices at Marineford
theory: Fans theorized that Bentham's willingness to sacrifice everything for Luffy in episode 451 was deliberately placed to foreshadow the theme of sacrifice that would dominate the Marineford War arc. The emotional weight of this scene would prepare viewers for even greater sacrifices to come in the war.
author: One Piece Analysis Community

evidence: Placement right before Marineford arc begins
Theme of sacrifice for loved ones is central to both arcs
